Description: Basic write/read operations with simple stimulus
Expected Behavior Tested: Basic FIFO functionality, write/read operations, data integrity, pointer management

Description: Packet writing operations with SOP/EOP handling
Expected Behavior Tested: Packet write functionality, SOP/EOP detection, write level tracking, buffer management during packet writes

Description: Packet reading operations with SOP/EOP handling
Expected Behavior Tested: Packet read functionality, SOP/EOP generation, read level tracking, buffer management during packet reads

Description: Comprehensive reset testing including hardware and software reset
Expected Behavior Tested: Hardware reset (pck_proc_int_mem_fsm_rstn) functionality, software reset (pck_proc_int_mem_fsm_sw_rstn) functionality, all signals properly reset to default values, FIFO state cleared after reset

Description: Concurrent read/write operations with interleaved stimulus
Expected Behavior Tested: Concurrent read/write handling, data integrity during simultaneous operations, pointer management under concurrent access, level tracking accuracy

Description: Overflow scenarios when writing to full buffer
Expected Behavior Tested: FIFO fills up correctly, write count increments properly, write level increases, almost full flag assertion, full flag assertion, overflow handling when writing to full FIFO

Description: Underflow scenarios when reading from empty buffer
Expected Behavior Tested: FIFO empties correctly, read count increments properly, read level decreases, almost empty flag assertion, empty flag assertion, underflow handling when reading from empty FIFO

Description: Invalid packet scenario: SOP and EOP asserted simultaneously
Expected Behavior Tested: Invalid packet detection (in_sop && in_eop), packet drop functionality, write enable suppression for invalid packets, error handling for malformed packets

Description: Invalid packet scenario: SOP asserted without EOP in WRITE_DATA state
Expected Behavior Tested: Invalid packet detection (in_sop && ~in_eop_r1 && present_state_w==WRITE_DATA), packet drop functionality, state machine behavior for invalid conditions

Description: Invalid packet scenario: EOP asserted before packet length completion
Expected Behavior Tested: Invalid packet detection (count_w < pck_len_r2-1 && pck_len_r2!=0 && in_eop_r1), packet drop functionality, length validation during packet processing

Description: Invalid packet scenario: EOP not asserted at expected packet length
Expected Behavior Tested: Invalid packet detection (count_w == pck_len_r2-1 || pck_len_r2==0 && ~in_eop_r1 && present_state_w==WRITE_DATA), packet drop functionality, packet boundary validation

Description: Mixed operations with various packet sizes and timing
Expected Behavior Tested: Mixed packet operations, varying packet lengths, different timing scenarios, comprehensive functionality testing across multiple operation types

Description: End-to-end comprehensive testing with all features
Expected Behavior Tested: Complete system functionality, all packet types, edge cases, stress testing, full coverage of design features and corner cases
